title: Ticket #4334: Add owner macro to DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG configuration
description:
I was just talking to Tom Downes of UW-M/LIGO about this. He really wants to set DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG in his global configuration files, to force the DAGMan workflow logs onto a local disk instead of NFS. But he's worried about name collisions if multiple users happen to have the same DAG file name.

If we could do something like this: 

  DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG = /localdisk/@(OWNER).@(DAG_NAME).nodes.log

it would help quite a bit...
remarks:
2014-May-08 11:30:22 by wenger:
Maybe also add @(NODE_NAME) (for sub-DAGs) if the other stuff isn't sufficient for LIGO. (@(NODE_NAME) would just be blank for a top-level DAG.)

2014-May-08 12:51:05 by wenger:
Tom is really eager to get @(OWNER) -- maybe see if we can get this into 8.2.1?

2014-Aug-12 14:33:47 by wenger:
On the LIGO call today, Tom said that they sometimes have a use case of incorporating the same DAG file into a parent DAG multiple times as a sub-DAG. This, I think, is what's driving the previous notes about @(NODE_NAME).

2014-Aug-15 12:53:52 by wenger:
Okay, I've implemented this and added a version history entry. But it still needs changes to the "main" part of the manual, and a review.

2014-Sep-03 15:31:13 by wenger:
Ah, nuts -- I committed this change on master -- I forgot that we have an 8.3.1 branch -- I'll have to cherry-pick it over to that...
